content: midi dress beach cover up using weight 4 yarn and a 6 5 mm hook chain an even number that fits the circumference of the largest part of your hips loosely for me this was 94 connect your chain to the first stitch to make a circle row 1 chain 4 chain 1 skip 1 stitch and treble_crochet into the 2nd stitch chain 1 skip 1 stitch and treble_crochet into the 2nd stitch repeat this all the way around the row slip_stitch into your first chain 4 post row 2-38 slip_stitch into the first chain space chain 4 chain 1 skip 1 stitch and treble_crochet into the 2nd stitch chain 1 skip 1 stitch and treble_crochet into the 2nd stitch repeat this all the way around the row slip_stitch into your first chain 4 post from this row continue until the skirt reaches from the top of your ankles to the smallest part of your waist top once your skirt reaches your waist continue treble crocheting in the chain spaces but only do 1/2 to 2/3 of the spaces in your round for me i had 47 treble crochets and 47 chain spaces in my round so instead i will only do 28 treble crochets row 1 slip_stitch into the first chain space chain 4 chain 1 skip 1 stitch and treble_crochet into the 2nd stitch chain 1 skip 1 stitch and treble_crochet into the 2nd stitch repeat this for the number of treble crochets you chose to cover your chest chain 4 and turn your work row 2-8 chain 1 skip 1 stitch and treble_crochet into the 2nd stitch chain 1 skip 1 stitch and treble_crochet into the 2nd stitch repeat this for the number of treble crochets you chose to cover your chest chain 4 and turn your work continue until the dress reaches from your ankles to your collarbone on your last row chain 1 instead of 4 cut your yarn and pull it through the loop back tie chain at least 120 weave it into and across the entire back of your dress at the waist and back out again on both sides tie in a bow for adjustable waist bottom trim row 1 insert your hook anywhere on the bottom of your dress single_crochet around the entire bottom of your dress row 2 double_crochet increasing once every 4 or 5 stitches around your entire bottom row weave in your tail ends and your cover up is now complete i hope you enjoyed this pattern if you did consider checking out my instagram @crittercornercrochet <3
